contextId.information: "empty and devastated."  This abstract noun phrase can be expressed as verb phrases.  AT: "they have destroyed the land and no one lives there" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
Here the abstract noun "abomination" can expressed as the verb "hate." AT: "I hate the incense the priests burn" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: incense is an abomination to me

contextId.information: The abstract noun "haughtiness" can be translated as an adjective. AT: "those people who are haughty will stop being haughty" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: the haughtiness of men will fall

contextId.information: This can be changed so that the abstract noun "justice" can be expressed by the verb "do what is fair." The abstract noun "killing" can be expressed as "killed one another." AT: "Yahweh waited for the people to do what is fair, but instead they killed one another" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: he waited for justice, but instead, there was killing

contextId.information: The abstract noun "destruction" can be translated as a verb. AT: "I will destroy him because I am angry with him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: my anger will lead to his destruction

contextId.information: This can be reworded so that the abstract noun "crash" is expressed as the verb "make a noise." AT: "and the branches will crash down on the ground and make a terrifying noise" or "and the branches will fall to the ground with a very loud noise" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The noun "pride" can be expressed with the adjective "proud." AT: "the beautiful city that the Chaldeans are so proud of" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

This can be reworded so that the abstract noun "slaughter" is expressed with the verb "kill." AT: "Get ready to kill the children of the king of Babylon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Prepare your slaughter for his children

contextId.information: This can be reworded so that the abstract noun "declaration" is expressed as the verb "declared" or "solemnly said." AT: "this is what Yahweh of hosts has declared" or "this is what Yahweh of hosts has solemnly said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: this is the declaration of Yahweh of hosts

contextId.information: This can be reworded so that the abstract noun "destruction" is expressed as the verb "destroyed." AT: "because their city is destroyed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
This can be reworded so that the abstract noun "advice" is expressed as the verb "advise." AT: "I will confuse those who advise the king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

The abstract nouns "sign" and "witness" can be expressed with the verbs "show" and prove."  AT: "The altar will show and prove that Yahweh of hosts is in the land of Egypt" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: It will be as a sign and a witness to Yahweh of hosts in the land of Egypt

contextId.information: The abstract noun "discipline" can be stated as a verb. AT: "when you disciplined them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: when your discipline was on them

contextId.information: The abstract noun "rest" can be stated as an adjective. AT: "This is the resting place" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

This can be reworded so that the abstract noun "declaration" is expressed as the verb "solemnly said." AT: "this is what Yahweh has declared" or "this is what Yahweh has solemnly said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: this is the declaration of Yahweh

contextId.information: This can be reworded so the abstract noun "song" is stated as a verb. AT: "You will sing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The word "terror" can be expressed with the adjective "terrified." AT: "all of their confidence because they are terrified" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The word "sight" can be expressed with the verb "see." AT: "when they see the flag of Yahweh's army" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: at the sight of Yahweh's battle flag

contextId.information: The noun phrase "the gain of oppression" can be expressed as a verb phrase. AT: "he who hates the riches that come from harming other people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: he who despises the gain of oppression

contextId.information: This can be reworded so that the abstract noun "declaration" is expressed as the verb "solemnly said." See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:isa:14:21|14:22]]. AT: "This is what Yahweh has declared" or "This is what Yahweh has solemnly said"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: This is the declaration of Yahweh

contextId.information: The word "devastation" can be translated with a verb. AT: "by devastating them with war" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
Here "darkness" refers to places that are secret. AT: "treasures in dark places" or "the treasures in secret places" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

Yahweh speaks of saving his people soon as if his salvation were a person who does not wait to act. AT: "I will not wait to save you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

The abstract noun "righteousness" can be stated as the adjective "right." AT: "I will cause you to be strong again because you will do what is right" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: In righteousness I will reestablish you
